item.title: Disintegrated tarmac, 22nd July
item.description:
In 2023/2024 I highlighted the disintegrating tarmac issue to Barnet. An inspector subsequently came out but accidentally marked up multiple smaller areas for repair on the opposite side of the street instead, that were less significant. Vans and large delivery vehicles continue to park on the near side of the road and the damage to the tarmac is getting worse and gradually spreading wider. It needs to be repaired.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Lytton Close, Hampstead Garden Suburb, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sub letting, 22nd July
item.description:
Flat 145 The Beckers is sub letting to multiple tenants. It is causing disruption to other residents and I’m pretty sure this isn’t legal. Council should look into this.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rectory Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sewage smell, 22nd July
item.description:
For the pass month from 9pm there has been a strong sewage smell. I can smell it even with my windows closed. Its giving me headache and making my family unsettle. Please investigate and stop the smell
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sunningdale Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Railing still not fixed, 22nd July
item.description:
Railing missing from gate. Multiple people seen late at night going in and out of the square through this railing in “closed” hours. Reported months ago and still not fixed.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): De Beauvoir Square, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Electrical recycling bin vandalised, 22nd July
item.description:
The electrical recycling bin on Borough High Street has been broken open and is full of general waste. It is unusable as an electrical recycling point. You need to repair it and make it more resistant to being broken open.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hulme Place, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bed Mattress, 22nd July
item.description:
Bed mattress left on side road by someone living next door. Has now been removed and left on road by another person. Taking up parking space. Noticed left there from 19th July at around 10:41. Snapshots from ring camera.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Worbeck Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaves constantly swept to the side, 22nd July
item.description:
For some reason the leaves are constantly swept just to the side in front of Greenwich academy. Never picked up or cleared. It’s been more than a year like this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Blackheath Road, London

item.title: Massive dog off the lead behaving aggressive, 22nd July
item.description:
Today I walked my son in the buggy on se93ha and this massive dog came out of house number 17 making his way our way and the owner made no efforts to grab him, I froze, she was completely dismissive of my fear. It is my understanding that he has been aggressive towards others dog walkers on the road and they haven’t made a complaint to avoid falling out with the owner.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hever Croft, Coldharbour, London
Report on FixMyStreet
